urls.resource_name: ELEMENT (FDZ at IQB) study landing / dataset info
urls.why_needed: Primary landing page at IQB's Research Data Centre describing the ELEMENT study and how to request the Scientific Use Files (SUFs) needed to replicate the analyses.

urls.resource_name: ELEMENT Scientific Use File (DOI landing)
urls.why_needed: Persistent DOI landing for the ELEMENT dataset (the actual Scientific Use File / data package used for the paper).

urls.resource_name: ELEMENT codebook (DOI)
urls.why_needed: Codebook / variable overview for ELEMENT (variable names, labels and structure needed to construct variables in replication).

urls.resource_name: ELEMENT Skalendokumentation / instrument documentation (DOI)
urls.why_needed: Documentation of test instruments and scales (contains item content, scoring, and IRT details necessary to re-construct the English Cloze scores and control measures).

urls.resource_name: ELEMENT – Skalenhandbuch (HU-Berlin edoc)
urls.why_needed: Downloadable handbook (PDF) documenting the ELEMENT instruments, variable descriptions and weight/tracking variables used in analysis.

urls.resource_name: ELEMENT Scales Handbook (English version DOI)
urls.why_needed: English-language handbook of scales for ELEMENT (useful if you need instrument descriptions / item wording in English).

urls.resource_name: FDZ at IQB - Data access / SUF application instructions
urls.why_needed: Shows the application process and legal/contractual requirements for obtaining the anonymized Scientific Use Files (SUFs) from IQB.

urls.resource_name: DESI study (IQB landing page) – alternative/related dataset
urls.why_needed: DESI (Deutsch–Englisch–Schülerleistungen-International) is a related large German dataset referenced in the paper and can serve as an alternative replication source with English competence, immigrant-status and background variables.

urls.resource_name: DESI (Forschungsdaten Bildung) study page (English)
urls.why_needed: Entry describing DESI and data-access procedures at the national educational research data infrastructure — useful as an alternative dataset for replication if ELEMENT access is constrained.

urls.resource_name: ACER ConQuest (IRT software)
urls.why_needed: ConQuest was used in the study to scale test items (one-parameter IRT) and is needed to reproduce the item-response scaling / WLEs if re-running the same IRT steps.

urls.resource_name: Mplus (statmodel.com)
urls.why_needed: Authors combined results across multiple imputed datasets and ran nested/complex-sample regressions using MPlus 5.21; Mplus or equivalent software is required to re-run their reported models (or to port MPlus syntax to alternative software).

urls.resource_name: mice (R package for multiple imputation)
urls.why_needed: Alternative open-source tool to perform multiple imputation (the paper used five imputations); useful if replicators prefer R instead of MPlus for imputation.

urls.resource_name: survey (R package for complex survey / clustered data)
urls.why_needed: Alternative open-source tool to run regressions that account for clustering (students nested in classes) as the authors did with MPlus 'type=complex'.

missing.resource_name: Original analysis code / MPlus syntax used by the authors (regression models, pooling across imputations, variable recodes)
missing.search_query: "Maluch" "MPlus" syntax "The effect of speaking a minority language at home" OR "Jessica Maluch" "MPlus" "syntax" "ELEMENT"

missing.resource_name: Author-provided imputed datasets and exact imputation model specification (the five imputed datasets used in the paper)
missing.search_query: ELEMENT imputed datasets "Lehmann & Lenkeit" "imputation" "ELEMENT" "MPlus" "imputed" "data"

missing.resource_name: Authors' data processing / analysis scripts (SPSS/Stata/R) for variable construction, recoding of 'bilingual group' and calculation of HISEI / cultural capital measures
missing.search_query: "Jessica Tsimprea Maluch" "code" OR "script" OR "replication" "ELEMENT" "bilingual" "HISEI" "codebook"

urls.resource_name: AEJ article page (Anderson, 2011)
urls.why_needed: Official article page (paper text, tables, and link to the replication package / supplementary materials used in the published analysis).

urls.resource_name: AEA replication package (AEJApp-2009-0289_data.zip)
urls.why_needed: Publisher-hosted replication package referenced by the article (contains the author’s replication files/data bundle distributed via AEA/ICPSR).

urls.resource_name: ICPSR / openICPSR landing for 'Replication data for: Caste as an Impediment to Trade' (Anderson)
urls.why_needed: Stable archive/DOI landing page for the AEJ replication deposit (alternate access point for the replication files/data used to reproduce tables and figures).

urls.resource_name: World Bank Microdata: Uttar Pradesh and Bihar Survey of Living Conditions 1997-1998 (UP–Bihar SLC / LSMS)
urls.why_needed: Primary household and village microdata used in the paper (household and village questionnaires, data files and metadata necessary to (re)construct variables used in regressions).

urls.resource_name: UP–Bihar 1997-98 Household Questionnaire (download)
urls.why_needed: Questionnaire and codebook to map survey questions to variables (needed to construct income, irrigation, caste, tubewell and buyer/seller indicators).

urls.resource_name: UP–Bihar 1997-98 Village Questionnaire (download)
urls.why_needed: Village-level instrument used to derive village caste-dominance, amenities and market/infrastructure controls used in the paper.

urls.resource_name: UP–Bihar 1997-98: Introduction to the Data Sets (documentation)
urls.why_needed: Technical documentation and sampling information required to understand sample design, weighting and variable definitions.

urls.resource_name: UP–Bihar 1997-98: Field Manual (documentation)
urls.why_needed: Field manual with enumerator instructions and variable definitions necessary for correct variable construction and replication.

urls.resource_name: Census of India (NADA catalog) / District Census Handbooks (village amenities, 2001)
urls.why_needed: Village-level amenities and infrastructure data from Census 2001 that Anderson cites and uses to control for village public goods and water sources.

urls.resource_name: Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) - Government of India
urls.why_needed: Source for district/village-level groundwater statistics and parameters (groundwater levels, stage of groundwater development) cited in the paper.

urls.resource_name: India-WRIS / National water resources data portal
urls.why_needed: Alternate/aggregated water resources and groundwater data (hydrogeological and district-level groundwater indicators) that can reproduce the groundwater controls used in the paper.

missing.resource_name: Author's original regression code / do‑files (explicit mapping from AEJ tables to variables)
missing.search_query: Siwan Anderson 'Caste as an Impediment to Trade' do-file replication code OR 'AEJApp-2009-0289' dofile 'Anderson' 'Caste as an Impediment to Trade' 'do' 'stata'

missing.resource_name: Exact Central Ground Water Board dataset/annual report file used (year/version) for district groundwater controls cited in paper
missing.search_query: Central Ground Water Board 'groundwater' 'district' 'yearbook' 2001 'groundwater levels' 'Ganga plain' 'Central Ground Water Board' 'annual report' 'data download' '2000 2001'

urls.resource_name: European Social Survey (ESS) — Data portal
urls.why_needed: Primary individual‑level microdata used in the paper (ESS rounds 1–4, 2002–2009) and the round/variable documentation necessary to construct the immigration‑concern and political‑trust variables.

urls.resource_name: ESS — Core questionnaire and question wording
urls.why_needed: Exact ESS question wordings (e.g. trust items B2/B5 and the immigration attitude items) and coding needed to replicate variable construction and indices described in the paper's appendix.

urls.resource_name: Nottingham ePrints landing for McLaren (2012)
urls.why_needed: Author's institutional landing for the article that notes an accompanying web appendix (identifies the author's materials and points to the web appendix described in the paper).

urls.resource_name: Cambridge Core / DOI for 'The Cultural Divide in Europe' (McLaren 2012)
urls.why_needed: Official published article (tables, modelling description, appendix references and provenance) to confirm exact model specifications, sample exclusions, and appendix references.

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project / MARPOR (CMP) dataset
urls.why_needed: Party manifesto data / party positions used in the paper's supplementary analyses and for identifying parties' immigration positions or party attention measures used in moderation tests.

urls.resource_name: World Bank — Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI)
urls.why_needed: Country‑level governance indicators (Kaufmann, Kraay & Mastruzzi) used as level‑3 predictors in the models (quality of governance index described in the paper).

urls.resource_name: Migrant Integration Policy Index (MIPEX / Integration Index)
urls.why_needed: Country‑level migrant‑policy measure referenced in the paper (used to test migrant‑policy moderation/robustness).

urls.resource_name: Eurostat — Social protection (ESSPROS) main tables
urls.why_needed: Social protection / social expenditure per head measures used as a level‑2/level‑3 control in the paper (social protection expenditure per head).

urls.resource_name: OECD.Stat (GDP per capita, unemployment, labour statistics)
urls.why_needed: Country‑level economic controls cited in the paper (GDP per capita, unemployment rate in year before survey) used in level‑3 models.

urls.resource_name: HLM software (Scientific Software International)
urls.why_needed: Software used by the author for multilevel / hierarchical linear modelling (the paper reports HLM-estimated models).

urls.resource_name: Kaufmann, Kraay & Mastruzzi (2009) — WGI (Policy Research Working Paper + data)
urls.why_needed: Original WGI paper and documentation (1996–2008 update) cited in the paper and useful for replicating the governance index construction used by the author.

missing.resource_name: McLaren (2012) web appendix / 'Percent vote for far-right (anti-immigration) parties' file (full table and party list by country/round)
missing.search_query: McLaren 'Cultural Divide in Europe' web appendix 'Percent vote for far-right' 'McLaren_Cultural_Divide_in_europe_Web_appendix' OR 'Percent vote for far-right' McLaren 2012 web appendix

missing.resource_name: Author's replication code / analysis scripts (HLM input files, data‑prep scripts, exact model syntax, IV estimation files)
missing.search_query: Lauren McLaren 'Cultural Divide in Europe' replication code OR replication materials OR 'web appendix' OR 'replication package' 'Lauren McLaren' 'The cultural divide in Europe' 'replication'

missing.resource_name: Exact variable‑level codebook / data files as used by the author (author‑constructed indices and the exact ESS variable recoding dataset used for HLM)
missing.search_query: McLaren 2012 'Cultural Divide in Europe' variable coding appendix 'concern about immigration' coding 'ESS' 'IMBGECO' 'IMUECL' 'IMRPLACE' 'variable coding' 'web appendix' 'McLaren'

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS Public Data File (FHCS/FEVS public release)
urls.why_needed: Primary access point / request form to obtain the 2006 Federal Human Capital Survey (FHCS) public release microdata (the dataset used in the paper) and associated codebook.

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS main page
urls.why_needed: Official survey landing page with background, years (FHCS → FEVS), links to reports and documentation needed to understand survey items and sampling frame.

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS Technical Reports
urls.why_needed: Contains methodology, weighting procedures, and technical documentation required to replicate variable construction, weighting, and standard-error calculations.

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS Data Reports
urls.why_needed: Governmentwide and agency-level reports (tables/percentages) useful for validating descriptive statistics and ensuring the replication sample matches reported summaries.

urls.resource_name: Original article DOI (Pitts, Marvel, & Fernandez 2011, Public Administration Review)
urls.why_needed: Author-supplied model specification, dependent/independent variable definitions, coefficient table (e.g., Job satisfaction = -0.444, SE = 0.0163) and other details required to implement the same analyses on new data.

urls.resource_name: Clarify (King, Tomz, & Wittenberg)
urls.why_needed: Authors used King/Tomz/Wittenberg's Clarify program to compute predicted probabilities and Monte Carlo simulations; the tool or equivalent is needed to reproduce the paper's simulation/clarification steps.

urls.resource_name: VA All Employee Survey (AES) 2018 project (DataLumOS) — contains de‑identified FEVS items
urls.why_needed: Example of a public deidentified microdata file that contains FEVS items (useful as a feasible alternative/new sample if obtaining the 2006 governmentwide microdata is restricted).

missing.resource_name: Authors' original analysis code / replication scripts (Stata .do or other scripts) for Pitts, Marvel & Fernandez (2011)
missing.search_query: Pitts Marvel Fernandez 2011 'So Hard to Say Goodbye' 'replication' 'do file' 'Stata' 'supplement' 'code' 'Pitts Marvel Fernandez do file'

missing.resource_name: Direct downloadable 2006 FHCS public-release microdata file (stable direct URL)
missing.search_query: 2006 FHCS 'public release data file' 'PRDF' 2006 'FEVS' 'FHCS' 'download' '2006 PRDF' 'EVSDATA' site:opm.gov

urls.resource_name: Weidmann & Callen — Online Appendix (Supplementary Material, PDF)
urls.why_needed: Contains the authors' appendix with the IEC recount description, Tables (including the additional tests for the inverted‑U), variable construction, and exact details used to build the recount-based fraud measure.

urls.resource_name: Article landing page — British Journal of Political Science (Weidmann & Callen 2012/2013)
urls.why_needed: Official article page and citation (DOI) that documents methods, references, and the paper's stated replication archive location.

urls.resource_name: AfghanistanElectionData.org — 2009 preliminary results / polling‑station data
urls.why_needed: Provides polling‑station–level 2009 returns and tools/exports that can be used to re-create the last‑digit forensic tests and district aggregations used by the authors.

urls.resource_name: Guardian Datablog — ECC audited polling stations spreadsheet (Google Sheet)
urls.why_needed: Guardian's mashup of the ECC/IEC audited sample (locations and ECC sample IDs) — useful to map and replicate recount‑based validation (the paper validates the last‑digit measure against the ECC sample).

urls.resource_name: Democracy International — Report on the 2009 Presidential Elections (audit/recount description)
urls.why_needed: Independent report describing the ECC/IEC audit procedures, sampling approach and findings — provides replication context and alternative counts for audit interpretation.

urls.resource_name: Afghanistan NRVA 2007-2008 (IHSN / CSO / MRRD catalog entry)
urls.why_needed: Source/metadata for the NRVA household survey the authors used to construct district-level controls (electrification, consumption).

urls.resource_name: LandScan (Oak Ridge National Laboratory) — Global population database
urls.why_needed: Population raster used to compute population and per‑capita normalization for district‑level violence measures (authors cite LandScan 2008).

urls.resource_name: USGS GTOPO30 (GTOPO30 Digital Elevation Model)
urls.why_needed: Elevation raster cited by the authors (used to construct district average elevation controls).

urls.resource_name: ACLED — Data download / export tool
urls.why_needed: One of the alternative event datasets the authors used for robustness checks (ACLED event counts aggregated to districts).

urls.resource_name: Global Terrorism Database (GTD) — download page (START, UMD)
urls.why_needed: Publicly available terrorism/incident dataset (GTD) that can substitute for WITS (WITS was discontinued) or be used as an alternative event source for robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: WITS (Worldwide Incidents Tracking System) — NCTC (referenced historical link)
urls.why_needed: WITS is the historical event dataset explicitly cited in the paper (the authors used WITS as an alternative robustness check); the link provides provenance and is referenced in the appendix (note: WITS is discontinued/merged and may be archived).

urls.resource_name: Electoral Complaints Commission (ECC) — Afghanistan (landing; historical)
urls.why_needed: Source of the ECC audit/recount sample and official ECC audit documentation that the paper uses to build the recount‑based fraud measure (paper cites ECC materials).

urls.resource_name: Independent Election Commission (IEC) Afghanistan — official site (historical postings of 2009 releases)
urls.why_needed: Primary publisher of the polling‑station returns (the authors cite IEC data releases on specific dates — the 19 Sept 2009 release with 27,163 stations and subsequent waves).

urls.resource_name: GeoIQ blog / Bill Greer — 'Impact of Violence on the Afghanistan Elections' (2009)
urls.why_needed: Contemporary, public data/analysis referenced by the authors as an event/violence data source and cross-check for early event counts.

missing.resource_name: Authors' published replication package (Dataverse study 'nilsw')
missing.search_query: Weidmann Callen 'Violence and Election Fraud' replication data dataverse nilsw OR 'nilsw' 'dvn.iq.harvard.edu' 'Weidmann' 'Callen' 'Violence and Election Fraud' dataverse

missing.resource_name: SIGACT (ISAF) 'significant activity' incident reports (the authors' primary short-window violence measure)
missing.search_query: ISAF SIGACT 'significant activity' reports Afghanistan August 2009 SIGACT download 'ISAF' 'SIGACT' '2009' 'incident reports' 'geocoded' 'significant activity' 'Afghanistan' 'SIGACT data'

missing.resource_name: Authors' analysis code (do‑files / R / Stata scripts used to compute last‑digit tests, district aggregation and regressions)
missing.search_query: Weidmann Callen 'Violence and Election Fraud' replication code 'Stata' 'R' 'do-file' 'replication' 'Weidmann' 'Callen' 'Violence and Election Fraud' 'code' 'dataverse' 'github'

missing.resource_name: Original IEC raw polling‑station release files (official IEC 19 Sep 2009 '27,163' release — direct downloadable CSV/zip)
missing.search_query: IEC '19 September 2009' '27,163' polling stations 'IEC' '2009' 'polling station' 'download' '27,163' '19 September 2009' 'IEC Afghanistan' 'results file' 'polling stations' 'csv' 'pdf'

urls.resource_name: Citymapper Mobility Index (CMI) landing page
urls.why_needed: Primary source/landing page for the Citymapper Mobility Index used by the paper (original mobility metric and documentation).

urls.resource_name: Citymapper CMI API endpoint
urls.why_needed: Programmatic endpoint that has been used to fetch the raw CMI time series (used by community R packages/scripts to download historical CMI values).

urls.resource_name: andodet/citymappR (GitHub)
urls.why_needed: Open-source R wrapper that downloads/parses Citymapper's mobility index (shows how to call the API endpoint and parse its output).

urls.resource_name: Citymapper announcement: CMI taken offline
urls.why_needed: Official notice that the CMI was taken offline (explains that original Citymapper time series may no longer be directly available and motivates alternative data sources or archived access).

urls.resource_name: Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker (OxCGRT) GitHub
urls.why_needed: Comprehensive, time-stamped policy measures (school/workplace closures, public transport restrictions, stringency index) useful to replicate authors' coding of social‑distancing interventions across cities/countries.

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data — COVID government response (OxCGRT visual/CSV access)
urls.why_needed: User-friendly site and CSV links for OxCGRT-derived policy variables and dates (alternate access to policy timing used for replication).

urls.resource_name: Google COVID-19 Community Mobility Reports (landing)
urls.why_needed: High-quality alternative mobility dataset (transit/retail/workplace categories) to replicate the mobility‑policy association if Citymapper data are unavailable.

urls.resource_name: Google Community Mobility global CSV
urls.why_needed: Direct downloadable CSV of Google mobility series (practical replacement/source for replication analyses).

urls.resource_name: Apple Mobility Trends Reports (landing)
urls.why_needed: Another independent mobility dataset (driving/walking/transit) that can be used as a robustness check or substitute for Citymapper CMI.

urls.resource_name: Globalization and Health (March 2020) — cross-city Citymapper analysis
urls.why_needed: Peer-reviewed cross-city analysis using Citymapper CMI that documents CMI coverage, baseline definitions, and issues (helps reconstruct cities list, baseline period and variable definitions).

urls.resource_name: medRxiv preprint DOI for Malik et al. (2020)
urls.why_needed: Original paper / methods to replicate (reference to authors' described data, sample, model and reported effect sizes).

missing.resource_name: Authors' compiled analysis dataset (the 1,025-observation Citymapper dataset used in the paper)
missing.search_query: Malik Couzens Omer 'Citymapper' 'data' 'supplementary' 'dataset' '1,025' 'Citymapper Mobility Index' Malik Omer Couzens dataset download

missing.resource_name: Authors' analysis code / regression scripts (model code used to estimate the 23% effect and 95% CI)
missing.search_query: Malik Couzens Omer 'Citymapper' 'code' 'analysis' 'GitHub' 'supplementary material' 'mobility' 'social distancing' 'regression' 'mixed-effects' 'code'

missing.resource_name: Exact list of the 41 cities and the authors' coding (dates and moderate/intense classification) of social distancing measures
missing.search_query: Malik Couzens Omer '41 cities' 'Citymapper' 'list of cities' 'social distancing' 'moderate' 'intense' 'closure' 'supplementary' 'appendix'

missing.resource_name: Archived daily Citymapper CMI time series snapshots (March 2–26, 2020) if original API/page is offline
missing.search_query: site:web.archive.org "citymapper.com/cmi" "March 2020" "Citymapper Mobility Index" OR "gobot_tab/data" archive

urls.resource_name: Article DOI (Lindqvist & Östling 2010)
urls.why_needed: Official DOI landing for the paper; points to the Cambridge Core article page and links the Supplementary Appendix used by the authors.

urls.resource_name: Cambridge Core article page (Lindqvist & Östling 2010)
urls.why_needed: Paper text, Appendix A variable definitions, and the article page that hosts the Supplementary Appendix / data file used in the published analyses.

urls.resource_name: Supplementary dataset (Supplementary Appendix XLS) from Cambridge Core
urls.why_needed: Authors' published supplementary dataset/table (country-level data and computed polarization measures) — core file for replicating country-level regressions and reported coefficients.

urls.resource_name: World Values Survey (WVS) — Trend / data download page
urls.why_needed: Source of individual-level survey items (EQUALITY, PRIVATE, GOV, COMP and party sympathy variables) used to compute country-level polarization measures.

urls.resource_name: Database of Political Institutions (Beck et al. / World Bank catalog)
urls.why_needed: Party seat shares, government/opposition classification, presidential regime / electoral rule indicators used to compute government/legislature concentration measures (HERFGOV, HERFLEG, NGOV, NLEG, GOVSEATS).

urls.resource_name: Polity IV Project (Systemic Peace) — Polity data
urls.why_needed: Polity / democracy scores used to classify 'strong' democracies (Polity/DEMOC measures referenced by the paper).

urls.resource_name: Economic Freedom of the World (Gwartney & Lawson) — data page (EFW)
urls.why_needed: Source for the government consumption variables (authors reference Gwartney & Lawson 2008 for GOVCONS/GOVTRANSSUB) and related country-level government-size measures.

urls.resource_name: World Development Indicators (World Bank)
urls.why_needed: Bulk country covariates used as controls (GDP per capita, trade openness, population shares, etc.) and alternative sources for government/consumption series.

urls.resource_name: Quality of Government (QoG) dataset / data downloads (University of Gothenburg)
urls.why_needed: Provides compiled indices (trust, corruption, property-rights proxies, press-freedom/CPI crosswalks) and many of the institutional controls the paper cites (used in robustness checks).

urls.resource_name: Transparency International — Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI)
urls.why_needed: Corruption index referenced (CORRUPTION) and used as a robustness control in some regressions.

urls.resource_name: Reporters Without Borders (RSF) — Press freedom / press freedom index
urls.why_needed: Press-freedom index (PFREEDOM) referenced in the paper's robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: Freedom House — Freedom in the World
urls.why_needed: Alternative democracy/classification source used by the authors for some countries where Polity is missing (Freedom House indexes referenced in Appendix A).

missing.resource_name: Authors' analysis code (replication code: Stata .do, R scripts, or similar) used to generate tables/figures
missing.search_query: Lindqvist Ostling 'Political Polarization and the Size of Government' replication code do-file 'replication' 'data' 'Lindqvist' 'Östling' 'supplementary' 'do' 'stata' 'R'

missing.resource_name: Exact Gwartney & Lawson GOVCONS / GOVTRANSSUB file or variable name used by authors (2003–2005 averages as used in paper)
missing.search_query: Gwartney Lawson 2008 government consumption 'GOVCONS' 'transfers and subsidies' 'GOVTRANSSUB' data '2003-2005' 'Gwartney Lawson data download' 'government consumption as fraction of total consumption'

urls.resource_name: GEM APS data landing (Adult Population Survey)
urls.why_needed: Primary microdata used in the paper (GEM 2010 APS individual- and national-level files; needed to construct entrepreneurship measures and country–age–year cells).

urls.resource_name: Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) data index
urls.why_needed: GEM project/data portal and documentation (alternate landing page and links to manuals, codebooks and annual data files).

urls.resource_name: GEM 2010 Global Report / documentation
urls.why_needed: 2010 GEM report and background documentation (context and variable definitions for the 2010 data used in the paper).

urls.resource_name: Flash Eurobarometer (FESE) overview — GESIS
urls.why_needed: FESE (Flash Eurobarometer) is the robustness/verification dataset the authors used to construct GEM-like entrepreneurship measures for European countries.

urls.resource_name: GESIS data catalogue / Eurobarometer dataset access
urls.why_needed: GESIS data catalogue and dataset DOIs (access to the FESE microdata and documentation used as the paper’s robustness check).

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census Bureau — International Data Base (IDB)
urls.why_needed: Source of single-year age population counts and age-structure statistics used to compute s_a, median age and to estimate the demographic parameter r.

urls.resource_name: Census IDB API endpoint (single-year age series)
urls.why_needed: Programmatic access to the IDB single-year age counts (useful for reconstructing F(a,r), median ages, and sample weights).

urls.resource_name: World Bank indicator SP.DYN.TFRT.IN (Total fertility rate)
urls.why_needed: Fertility/time-series reference data the paper cites for demographic context and robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: World Bank indicator NV.AGR.TOTL.ZS (Agriculture, value added % of GDP)
urls.why_needed: One of the macro controls (agriculture share) the paper uses as a country-level covariate.

urls.resource_name: World Bank / Doing Business: Cost to start a business (% of GNI per capita)
urls.why_needed: Start-up cost variable (cost of business registration as % of GNI per capita) used as a control in country-level regressions.

urls.resource_name: Penn World Table (GGDC PWT landing)
urls.why_needed: Source for GDP per capita and other macro controls (authors cite PWT v7.1 for GDPpc/growth).

urls.resource_name: Barro–Lee educational attainment dataset (Barro & Lee 1950–2010)
urls.why_needed: Source of country-level tertiary/college attainment controls used in the regressions.

urls.resource_name: Property Rights Alliance / International Property Rights Index (IPRI)
urls.why_needed: Property-rights index (legal/IP/physical property rights) the paper uses as a 2010 control variable.

urls.resource_name: International Property Rights Index — full report pages
urls.why_needed: Direct landing for IPRI reports (2010 edition is the index the paper cites).

urls.resource_name: DHS Office of Immigration Statistics — Yearbook of Immigration Statistics 2012
urls.why_needed: Cited when authors discuss immigration/median-age concerns (used to argue immigration is unlikely to bias cross-country median-age variation).

urls.resource_name: NBER Working Paper 20506 — 'Demographics and Entrepreneurship' (Liang, Wang, Lazear)
urls.why_needed: Working-paper version of the published article (useful to check appendix, methods and any supplementary materials referenced in the working paper).

urls.resource_name: Journal of Political Economy DOI landing page (2018 article)
urls.why_needed: Official published article (JPE) and the place where the paper’s footnotes refer to 'supplementary material online'; required to locate any publisher-hosted supplements or appendices.

urls.resource_name: Stanford SIEPR working paper landing (Discussion Paper 14‑003)
urls.why_needed: Stanford discussion-paper page for the authors’ pre-publication version (may host PDF or replication appendix).

urls.resource_name: Stanford GSB publication page (author page / working paper)
urls.why_needed: Author-hosted description/working-paper listing; useful for contacting authors or checking for posted replication files.

urls.resource_name: GEM Manual / methodological documentation (Bosma et al. 2012)
urls.why_needed: Methodology/codebook referenced in the paper (sampling weights, variable definitions, APS/NES manuals).

missing.resource_name: Authors' replication / analysis code (Stata/R/Do-files) used to generate tables and to estimate r
missing.search_query: 'Demographics and Entrepreneurship' replication code do-file Liang Wang Lazear 'replication' 'do' 'Stata' 'code' 'supplementary' 'appendix'

missing.resource_name: Journal of Political Economy online supplementary materials / publisher-hosted appendix for the 2018 JPE article
missing.search_query: Journal of Political Economy 'Demographics and Entrepreneurship' 'supplementary material' 'online appendix' 'supplemental' 'Liang' 'Wang' 'Lazear'

urls.resource_name: OSF project (original preprint: 'The Importance of Cultural Tightness and Government Efficiency For Understanding COVID-19 Growth and Death Rates')
urls.why_needed: Authors stated all analysis code and data are available here — primary reproduction/replication files for the preprint (country lists, processed variables, scripts).

urls.resource_name: OSF project (Lancet Planetary Health paper: 'The relationship between cultural tightness–looseness and COVID-19 cases and deaths')
urls.why_needed: Contains data and scripts used by Gelfand et al. (2021) for analyses of tightness and COVID outcomes (57-country tightness scores, COVID time-series used in that published analysis).

urls.resource_name: ECDC daily cases/deaths CSV (geographic distribution of COVID-19 cases and deaths)
urls.why_needed: Original COVID-19 daily case/death time series used by the authors (their summary reports ECDC as the source for daily case/death counts).

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data — OWID global COVID-19 time series (direct CSV)
urls.why_needed: Author-used or acceptable alternative global COVID-19 case/death time series for replication and for drawing a fresh sample (OWID aggregates multiple official sources and is widely used for cross‑national replication).

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data GitHub (COVID-19 data repository)
urls.why_needed: Alternative source and programmatic access to the OWID COVID datasets and per-country metadata for replication and updated samples.

urls.resource_name: World Bank — Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI) landing page
urls.why_needed: Primary source for the Government Effectiveness indicator (the paper reports using the World Bank Government Efficiency/Effectiveness index).

urls.resource_name: World Bank Databank — WGI (download interface)
urls.why_needed: Stable interface to download the Government Effectiveness series and percentile ranks for the specific vintage(s) used in the paper (e.g., 2017 values referenced in the manuscript).

urls.resource_name: IMF — World Economic Outlook (WEO) database
urls.why_needed: Source for GDP per capita (the paper cites IMF 2019 release); use to obtain the same 2019 GDP per capita values for covariate construction.

urls.resource_name: World Bank — Gini index (World Development Indicators)
urls.why_needed: Source for country-level income-inequality (Gini) covariate used in the paper.

urls.resource_name: CIA World Factbook — Median age (country comparison / download)
urls.why_needed: Source the authors cite for median age covariate (their summary indicates median age from CIA World Factbook).

urls.resource_name: Lancet Planetary Health paper (Gelfand et al., 2021) PubMed page
urls.why_needed: Published version of the authors' related analysis that documents the 57-country tightness scores and analytic approach; useful for matching variables/analytic decisions and for locating supplementary files/references.

urls.resource_name: Lancet Planetary Health paper (ScienceDirect page, full text & appendix)
urls.why_needed: Contains methods, appendix and references to supplemental materials and model descriptions (useful to replicate modeling choices and EGT model parameters).

missing.resource_name: Direct downloadable CSV/TSV file with the country-level cultural tightness scores used in the study (explicit file URL)
missing.search_query: site:osf.io "tightness" "scores" csv OR site:osf.io "tightness" "tightness_scores" "Gelfand"

missing.resource_name: Exact analysis scripts (R / Python) used to: (a) fit per-country exponential growth slopes from daily cases, and (b) run the second-stage weighted cross-national regressions (including code for interaction tests and weights)
missing.search_query: Gelfand "infection growth" R script OR "per-country growth" "R" site:osf.io OR "weighted regression" "Gelfand" "COVID" "R" "script"

missing.resource_name: EGT simulation code (the evolutionary game‑theory simulation implementation used to produce Figure 4 / supplement)
missing.search_query: Gelfand "evolutionary game" "simulation" code OR "EGT" "simulation" "Gelfand" "code" site:github.com OR site:osf.io

urls.resource_name: Unacast Social Distancing Scoreboard (landing)
urls.why_needed: Primary source / provider of the county-level mobility / average distance-traveled measures used as the outcome.

urls.resource_name: Unacast Social Distancing Scoreboard schema & documentation
urls.why_needed: Schema and variable definitions needed to construct the exact distancing measure (column names, units, reference period).

urls.resource_name: Unacast sample county CSV (sds-v3-sample-county.csv.gz)
urls.why_needed: Representative sample CSV of the Unacast county-level dataset (useful for parsing/column validation and testing code before acquiring full data).

urls.resource_name: Unacast blog / methodology for the Social Distancing Scoreboard
urls.why_needed: Public explanation of Unacast methods and technical details (helps replicate how movement was measured and normalized to baseline).

urls.resource_name: MIT Election Data & Science Lab — County Presidential Election Returns (Harvard Dataverse DOI:10.7910/DVN/VOQCHQ)
urls.why_needed: County-level 2016 presidential vote shares (used to compute county % support for Trump—the main political exposure).

urls.resource_name: MIT Election Data and Science Lab (MEDSL) data landing
urls.why_needed: MEDSL project page and links to the county-level presidential returns and related election datasets for provenance and alternative downloads.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census Bureau — ACS 2018 5-year API (variables documentation)
urls.why_needed: Source for county-level ACS variables (2014–2018 5-year estimates) such as per-capita income, race/ethnicity, educational attainment, workforce by industry—used for covariates and exposures.

urls.resource_name: American Community Survey (ACS) program landing page
urls.why_needed: Primary documentation and access point for ACS 5-year data (2014–2018) used to derive income per capita and other county covariates.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census 2010 Summary File 1 API
urls.why_needed: Access to 2010 decennial Census variables and geography (used for county-level rurality measure referenced in the paper).

urls.resource_name: The New York Times — county-level COVID-19 cases & deaths (GitHub)
urls.why_needed: County COVID-19 case counts used in the authors' sensitivity analyses (weekly case rates per million).

urls.resource_name: Published article (American Journal of Preventive Medicine) / PMC full text
urls.why_needed: Author methods, exact model specification, IQR values, and the explicit pointer to replication code (serves as the authoritative protocol to replicate).

urls.resource_name: Authors' replication code (github.com/nolankav/socialdistancing)
urls.why_needed: Replication/analysis code claimed by the authors in the paper — needed to reproduce their data processing and model steps (starting point for replication).

missing.resource_name: Full Unacast county-level numeric dataset (full 'Extended' dataset used by authors)
missing.search_query: Unacast full extended social distancing dataset research access 'Unacast Social Distancing' 'Full Extended Dataset' 'get started' partnerships@unacast.com research access

missing.resource_name: Confirmation / direct link to the authors' GitHub repository contents (if the repo is private or relocated)

missing.resource_name: Exact ACS variable list and codebook (authors' variable names / aggregation script) as used in their analysis

urls.resource_name: OECD PISA data file index (includes PISA 2003 links)
urls.why_needed: Primary landing/index listing for downloadable PISA 2003 TXT data files and the SPSS/SAS control files (student, school, cognitive) needed to recreate the international microdata.

urls.resource_name: PISA 2003 international student data (INT_stui_2003_v2.zip)
urls.why_needed: Core international student-level microdata file for PISA 2003 (contains background questionnaire variables used to build memorization, SAL scales, plausible values references, and weights).

urls.resource_name: PISA 2003 SPSS control file (student)
urls.why_needed: SPSS control/syntax file that defines variable positions, labels, and read-in instructions required to reconstruct the student dataset exactly as intended by PISA (needed to create the variables and scales used in the paper).

urls.resource_name: PISA 2003 Data Analysis Manual (SPSS)
urls.why_needed: Official guidance and example syntax for handling PISA sampling weights, replicate weights, and plausible values (PV) procedures used in the paper's analyses.

urls.resource_name: PISA 2003 Technical Report
urls.why_needed: Detailed documentation of sampling, test construction, plausible value generation, and overall PISA methodology required for correct multilevel and PV-aware analysis and weighting.

urls.resource_name: Learners for Life: Student Approaches to Learning (PISA SAL report)
urls.why_needed: Documentation and conceptual/measurement descriptions for the Student Approaches to Learning (SAL) constructs (memorization, elaboration, control strategies) used as moderators in the paper.

urls.resource_name: NCES PISA questionnaires page (includes PISA 2003 student questionnaire PDF)
urls.why_needed: Direct access to the PISA 2003 student questionnaire PDF so the exact questionnaire items used to build the memorization and other moderator scales can be inspected and coded identically.

urls.resource_name: EdSurvey (CRAN) R package
urls.why_needed: Open-source R package with functions to download/read PISA files and correctly analyze PISA data including plausible values and complex survey weights (facilitates PV-aware analyses and merging of student/school/cognitive files).

urls.resource_name: EdSurvey GitHub repository
urls.why_needed: Source, examples and utilities (downloadPISA/readPISA) that include the OECD PISA file URLs and show recommended workflows for reading and analyzing PISA 2003 with PVs in R.

urls.resource_name: intsvy (CRAN) R package
urls.why_needed: Alternative R package with helper functions for computing PISA (and other large-scale assessment) descriptive statistics and regression estimates that respect plausible values and sampling design — useful as a replication toolchain.

urls.resource_name: Seaton, Marsh & Craven (2010) AERJ article DOI page
urls.why_needed: Official article landing (citation, tables/figures, appendix descriptions). Needed to verify variable operationalizations, reported coefficients (memorization × school-average effect) and the authors' exact methods and thresholds.

urls.resource_name: ResearchGate PDF mirror of Seaton et al. (2010)
urls.why_needed: An accessible copy of the published paper (including tables and appendix) for verifying reported coefficients, item lists, and the authors' analytic descriptions when institutional access to the journal is limited.

urls.resource_name: HLM (Scientific Software International) software / vendor page
urls.why_needed: The paper cites HLM6 (Raudenbush, Bryk, & Congdon) as software used for multilevel modeling; if replicating with the same commercial software, HLM licensing/download information is here.

missing.resource_name: Original analysis code / HLM/SPSS syntax used by Seaton, Marsh & Craven (2010)
missing.search_query: Seaton Marsh Craven 2010 'Big-Fish-Little-Pond Effect' supplementary materials code HLM SPSS 'Seaton' 'Marsh' 'Craven' 'supplementary' 'syntax' 'code'

missing.resource_name: Processed analytic dataset (authors' cleaned PISA 2003 subset: exclusions, scale standardizations, schools with >10 students, per‑PV school means)

missing.resource_name: Exact HLM6 project/input files (if authors used HLM6) specifying model structure and random-effect specifications

urls.resource_name: OWID / ECDC full_data (cases & deaths by date & country)
urls.why_needed: Country-level daily confirmed COVID-19 case counts (ECDC-derived) needed to compute cases per million on 2020-04-03 and to construct lagged Y(-j).

urls.resource_name: OWID / ECDC locations (population)
urls.why_needed: Country population (and metadata) used to convert case counts to cases per 1 million (paper used 2018 population reference).

urls.resource_name: JHU CSSE confirmed global time series (raw CSV)
urls.why_needed: Alternative global confirmed-case time series (useful for robustness checks vs ECDC source used in the paper).

urls.resource_name: World Bank — Trade (% of GDP) indicator (NE.TRD.GNFS.ZS)
urls.why_needed: Country-level economic openness (trade as % of GDP) — the paper's openness variable.

urls.resource_name: World Bank API download — Trade (% of GDP) CSV
urls.why_needed: Direct CSV download for programmatic retrieval of trade (% of GDP) by country (convenient for replication).

urls.resource_name: World Bank — Population density (people per sq. km) (EN.POP.DNST)
urls.why_needed: Country-level population density (paper reports population density 2018 as a covariate).

urls.resource_name: World Bank API download — Population density CSV
urls.why_needed: Direct CSV download for programmatic retrieval of country population density (2018 values available).

urls.resource_name: EIU Democracy Index 2019 (report landing page)
urls.why_needed: Primary source for the Democracy Index 2019 scores cited in the paper (author referenced EIU/Wikipedia).

urls.resource_name: Wikipedia — Democracy Index (country scores table)
urls.why_needed: Convenient tabulated listing of 2019 Democracy Index scores (author reported obtaining 2019 scores from Wikipedia/EIU).

urls.resource_name: meteoblue climate (average temperature data portal)
urls.why_needed: Author-cited source for yearly average temperature by country; used to construct the temperature predictor.

urls.resource_name: IndexMundi (country climate / precipitation pages)
urls.why_needed: Author-cited source for average yearly precipitation by country (paper cites indexmundi).

urls.resource_name: WorldClim v2 (global gridded climate data — temp & precip)
urls.why_needed: High-quality alternative to meteoblue/indexmundi for mean annual temperature and annual precipitation (useful if per-country meteoblue tables are not available).

urls.resource_name: CHELSA climate data (temperature & precipitation)
urls.why_needed: Another authoritative global climate dataset (alternative source for mean annual temperature / precipitation when constructing country averages).

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data — COVID-19 GitHub (dataset repo)
urls.why_needed: Repository and documentation for OWID COVID-19 datasets (includes processed ECDC and other sources and population metadata).

urls.resource_name: Gerhold (2020) preprint (PsyArXiv / OSF)
urls.why_needed: Original paper describing the survey design, questionnaire items and the reported statistics (source of the claim to be replicated).

urls.resource_name: Teufel (2020) survey (Unipark landing)
urls.why_needed: Paper cites items taken from this University of Duisburg–Essen survey—useful for recreating the specific questionnaire items and response phrasing.

urls.resource_name: Robert Koch Institute — Situation Report (24 Mar 2020)
urls.why_needed: Background epidemic context and the same RKI situational statistics the original paper used to situate data-collection dates.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Panel — COVID-19 special survey (March 2020)
urls.why_needed: A readily-accessible, representative German panel COVID‑19 dataset (special March 2020 wave) that can serve as a feasible alternative/new sample for replication with comparable variables and timing.

urls.resource_name: YouGov / Imperial College COVID‑19 Behaviour Tracker (GitHub)
urls.why_needed: Public respondent‑level survey files including Germany for early-pandemic risk/perception items — pragmatic alternative source for replication samples and codebook.

urls.resource_name: Global Behaviors and Perceptions in the COVID-19 Pandemic (OSF project)
urls.why_needed: Large multi-country survey (OSF-hosted) with risk perception and coping items that can provide a comparable replication sample and questionnaire materials.

urls.resource_name: Bilendi / Respondi (ISO‑certified panel provider)
urls.why_needed: Commercial ISO‑certified online access panels (Respondi/Bilendi) are a practical provider to recruit a new, quota‑representative German sample matching the original study design.

urls.why_needed: Project/report page (LaBeCo) from the same research group; contains metadata, project documentation and possible links/files relevant to the survey program and instruments used by the authors.

urls.why_needed: Author contact page (email on page) to request the original survey dataset and analysis code if not publicly archived.

urls.why_needed: Register/access point to download IFLS public-use datasets (including IFLS4) required to replicate the analyses.

urls.resource_name: World Bank Microdata Library — IFLS4 (related materials)
urls.why_needed: Stable catalog page that hosts IFLS4 documentation and direct downloads (user's guide, questionnaires, technical docs) used to construct variables and sample.

urls.resource_name: IFLS4 — Household / questionnaire PDF (download)

urls.resource_name: IFLS4 — Community/Facility technical document (download)
urls.why_needed: Community/facility module documentation (distance/access variables) used in the paper's covariates and sample construction.

urls.resource_name: IFLS4 — Household-level technical document (download)

urls.resource_name: John Strauss / USC IFLS page
urls.why_needed: Additional IFLS project resources, notes and publication links maintained by one of the IFLS principal investigators.

urls.resource_name: Example IFLS data-wrangling repository (GitHub)

urls.resource_name: GSS documentation / codebooks
urls.why_needed: Official GSS codebooks, questionnaire text, and variable documentation needed to identify the exact science and religion items (question wording and response codes).

urls.resource_name: Roper Center — General Social Survey landing page
urls.why_needed: Alternative archival access to GSS cumulative files and variable documentation (Roper distribution of NORC GSS materials).

urls.resource_name: ICPSR — General Social Survey, 1972-2010 [Cumulative File] (ICPSR 31521)
urls.why_needed: Cumulative GSS file that includes 2006, 2008, and 2010 items and variable harmonizations used in pooled analyses in the paper.

urls.why_needed: More recent cumulative GSS archive (includes 2010 and later) — useful if replications prefer a later cumulative release containing the waves used by the authors.

urls.why_needed: Convenience R package and data objects (panel and merged GSS datasets) that reproduce the 2006–2010 three-wave panel structure used by many researchers pooling those waves.

urls.resource_name: Social Forces article (DOI landing)
urls.why_needed: Primary article (full methods, tables, variable definitions, and citation information for replication).

urls.resource_name: Social Forces article landing (Oxford Academic)
urls.why_needed: Publisher landing page for the paper (contains abstract, author contact, and download/access options).

urls.resource_name: EPA — State Energy CO2 Emissions (2017 snapshot landing)
urls.why_needed: Authors cite EPA state CO2 emissions (fossil fuel combustion) as the dependent variable; snapshot contains the 1990–2014 (and related) state CO2 tables used in the paper.

urls.resource_name: EPA XLSX: State CO2 Emissions from Fossil Fuel Combustion (co2ffc_2014_0.xlsx)
urls.why_needed: Direct Excel file of state CO2 emissions (fossil-fuel combustion) values cited by the authors (used to construct the dependent variable for 2007–2013).

urls.resource_name: EIA — State Energy Data System (SEDS)
urls.why_needed: State energy production/consumption series used to construct the authors' 'energy production' control and to cross-check EPA/EIA fuel consumption inputs.

urls.resource_name: BLS — Current Employment Statistics (CES)
urls.why_needed: Source of average weekly working-hours series (CES/SAE) used by the authors for the key independent variable (state-level hours series).

urls.resource_name: BLS — State & Metro Area Employment, Hours, and Earnings (SAE)
urls.why_needed: State-level CES/SAE landing page and data access for average weekly hours and state employment series used to construct hours and employed-population % measures.

urls.resource_name: BLS — Labor Productivity and Costs (LPC)
urls.why_needed: Source for labor productivity / GDP-per-hour measures (authors disaggregate GDP into hours and productivity components).

urls.resource_name: BEA — GDP by State (GDP and manufacturing share)
urls.why_needed: Source for state GDP per capita and industry shares (manufacturing % of GDP) used as controls and for scale/composition decompositions.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census — American Community Survey (ACS) data
urls.why_needed: Source for average household size, working-age population % (age 15–64), and other demographic controls used in the paper.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census — Population estimates (state totals)
urls.why_needed: Official state population time-series used as a control (total population) in the models.

urls.resource_name: League of Conservation Voters (LCV) — National Environmental Scorecard
urls.why_needed: LCV congressional voting scores are the raw data used (by Dietz et al. and by the authors' state-environmentalism measure aggregation) as the time-invariant state environmentalism control.

urls.resource_name: Dietz et al. (2015) PNAS article — 'Political influences on greenhouse gas emissions from US states'
urls.why_needed: Provides the political/environmentalism variable and references/methods for constructing the state environmentalism measure cited and used in the Social Forces paper.

urls.resource_name: The Conference Board — Total Economy Database
urls.why_needed: Referenced by the authors; contains macroeconomic series that can be used to cross-check GDP/productivity measures or create alternate measures for robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: EPA — Inventory of U.S. Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Sinks (national inventory)
urls.why_needed: Provides emission factors and methodological documentation used by EPA in constructing the state CO2 estimates (important for understanding measurement).

urls.why_needed: Publicly available national MIS dataset (malaria testing, treatment, and symptom modules) that provides a feasible alternative/new sample for replication using independent data with comparable variables.

urls.resource_name: Kenya Malaria Indicator Survey (KMIS) 2010 — KNBS catalog
urls.why_needed: Another public MIS (closer in time to the trial) with malaria test and treatment variables that can serve as an alternative/new sample for replication.

urls.resource_name: Teaching subset / course exercises referencing E1-CohenEtAl-data.dta
urls.why_needed: Course page that hosts a small, classroom subset (E1-CohenEtAl-data.dta) used for teaching/replication exercises — useful for quick checks and reproducing basic results when the full replication package is large or gated.

missing.resource_name: Direct public URL for the AER2013-0267_data-code zip file (direct downloadable file link / file listing of the OpenICPSR item)
missing.search_query: AER2013-0267_data-code download Cohen Dupas Schaner "AER2013-0267_data-code" openICPSR download

missing.resource_name: Author-hosted repository (GitHub / personal webpage) with the full Stata/R do-files that generate every main table/figure
missing.search_query: Cohen Dupas Schaner do-file replication Stata "Price Subsidies" "do" "replication" "Cohen Dupas Schaner" GitHub

missing.resource_name: Dataverse deposit referenced by J‑PAL/IPA (explicit Dataverse dataset URL)
missing.search_query: Cohen Dupas Schaner Dataverse "Price Subsidies" "malaria" "Dataverse" "Cohen Dupas"

missing.resource_name: Separate administrative drug‑shop transaction raw files and codebook if they are archived separately from the main replication bundle
missing.search_query: drug shop transactions dataset Cohen Dupas Schaner "administrative" "voucher" "transactions" download codebook

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project (MP/MPDS) - Datasets landing
urls.why_needed: Primary source of the CMP/Manifesto codings (MPDS) and the Mapping Policy Preferences I dataset used by Andrews & Money to construct party positions and the PCA-based economic/social dimensions.

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project coding instructions & category scheme (handbooks/codebook)
urls.why_needed: Official CMP/MARPOR coding handbooks and category lists (with code numbers like 303, 401, etc.) required to select CMP categories and reproduce the authors' dimensional constructions.

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project — Election Level do-file (MP ELD do-file)
urls.why_needed: Stata do-file the Manifesto Project provides to compute election-level indicators (median voter, center of gravity, polarization, etc.) similar to measures used by Andrews & Money; useful to aggregate party-level scores into election/system-level dispersion measures.

urls.resource_name: manifestoR (GitHub)
urls.why_needed: R client and utilities to download, process and scale Manifesto Project data programmatically (mp_maindataset(), mp_codebook(), mp_corpus(), scaling functions), enabling replication of the PCA and position construction in R.

urls.resource_name: manifestoR (CRAN)
urls.why_needed: CRAN release and documentation for manifestoR (installation, function reference and vignettes) for programmatic access to MPDS and the codebook.

urls.resource_name: ParlGov (Parliaments & Governments Database) — landing
urls.why_needed: Authoritative, downloadable election and party results (seat shares, vote shares, election metadata) used to compute seat-weighted effective number of parties and party counts per election (alternative to CMP seat variables).

urls.resource_name: ParlGov — CSV data download (development/stable release)
urls.why_needed: Direct CSV/SQLite download of ParlGov tables (elections, election_result, parties) needed to compute/enumerate seat shares, party counts, and effective number of parties for replication.

urls.resource_name: CSES Integrated Module Dataset (IMD)
urls.why_needed: Contains election-level variables (including district magnitude and effective-number measures in some releases) that can be used to replicate robustness checks and the 'median district magnitude' control used by the authors.

urls.resource_name: National Elections Database (NED)
urls.why_needed: Alternative nationwide election results repository (party seat tallies and seat shares) if additional or country-specific seat/share data are needed to compute effective number of parties or to cross-check ParlGov/MP seat data.

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project — downloadable CSV of category scheme (handbook v4/v5 table)
urls.why_needed: Machine-readable CSV of the MARPOR category scheme (code, variable_name, domain, title, description) needed to select exactly the CMP categories (e.g., 303, 401, 402, ... , 701) used by Andrews & Money when constructing the economic and social dimensions.

missing.resource_name: Original analysis/replication code for Andrews & Money (2009) — PCA, party-count implementation, regression scripts, and do-files
missing.search_query: Andrews Money 2009 'Spatial Structure of Party Competition' replication code OR 'Andrews Money' '2009' 'replication code' 'jtandrews@ucdavis' 'Spatial Structure of Party Competition' 'supplemental' 'code' 'do-file' 'R script'

missing.resource_name: Exact script (Stata/R) listing the CMP category subset and PCA routines Andrews & Money used to construct the two dimensions
missing.search_query: Andrews Money 2009 PCA CMP categories 'economic dimension' 'social dimension' 'principal components' 'code' 'supplementary materials' 'Andrews Money 2009' 'Spatial Structure of Party Competition' 'codebook' 'supplemental appendix'

missing.resource_name: Authors' cleaned party-level dataset (party locations and dispersion measures) used in Tables/Figures
missing.search_query: Andrews Money 2009 'The Spatial Structure of Party Competition' data 'party locations' 'dispersion' 'replication data' 'Andrews Money data' 'jtandrews@ucdavis' 'supplementary data'

urls.resource_name: OECD STAN (Structural Analysis) database
urls.why_needed: Provides sectoral employment, value added and labour-input series (ISIC-based) used to construct manufacturing employment shares and productivity measures (STAN is the paper's cited source for workforce by sector).

urls.resource_name: OECD — International Trade by Commodity Statistics (ITCS)
urls.why_needed: Official OECD ITCS trade-by-commodity and partner-country statistics (SITC Rev.3) used to compute 'imports from the South' and related North–South trade measures.

urls.resource_name: OECD — International Direct Investment Statistics Yearbook / IDIS
urls.why_needed: Source for industry/sector-level FDI (net outflow/inflow) series cited in the paper (used to construct the net outflow of direct investment variable).

urls.resource_name: OECD FDI by industry (OECD.Stat indicators / FDI datasets)
urls.why_needed: OECD.Stat access point for disaggregated FDI flows/stocks by industry (practical place to download the FDI series used in the analysis).

urls.resource_name: OECD — National Accounts of OECD Countries, Vol. I: Main Aggregates (2006)
urls.why_needed: Provides the GDP and GDP per capita (USD at 2000 prices / PPP) series and documentation the paper cites for national affluence (per-capita income) construction.

urls.resource_name: OECD — Labour Force Statistics (2006 edition)
urls.why_needed: Source for unemployment and other labour-market control variables used in the regressions.

urls.resource_name: United Nations — National Accounts Main Aggregates (AMA) database
urls.why_needed: UN national accounts series used in the paper for (real) value added by sector and other national-account measures referenced in the methods.

urls.resource_name: UN — SITC Revision 3 (documentation/classification)
urls.why_needed: Documentation for SITC Revision 3 classification (paper restricts trade to SITC sections 5–8 to focus on manufactured goods).

urls.resource_name: UN — ISIC Revision 3 (documentation/classification)
urls.why_needed: ISIC Rev.3 sector definitions used by STAN and cited in the paper (manufacturing defined as ISIC 15–37).

urls.resource_name: OECD.Stat (data portal)
urls.why_needed: Main portal to query and download OECD datasets (STAN, ITCS, FDI, National Accounts, Labour Force) in machine-readable form for constructing the panel.

urls.resource_name: Author / University profile page for Christopher Kollmeyer (paper landing / DOI metadata)
urls.why_needed: Author page with paper metadata and DOI (useful for checking exact published specifications, appendix references, and contacting the author about replication materials).

missing.resource_name: Author's replication files / original Stata do-files and merged panel used in Kollmeyer (2009)
missing.search_query: Christopher Kollmeyer "Explaining Deindustrialization" replication data do-file stata "supplementary" "replication" "Explaining Deindustrialization"

missing.resource_name: Exact merged panel (author-processed country-year panel with variables: RME, NA, UPG, IMS, EXS, IMN, EXN, unemployment) made available by the author or journal
missing.search_query: Kollmeyer 2009 merged panel data "Explaining Deindustrialization" "manufacturing employment" "panel" "data" "1970 2003"

missing.resource_name: Journal supplementary materials / Appendix data files (if any) hosted by American Journal of Sociology or University of Chicago Press
missing.search_query: American Journal of Sociology "Explaining Deindustrialization" supplementary materials "Kollmeyer" "appendix" "data" "online supplement"

missing.resource_name: Precise OECD ITCS tables/series (SITC Rev.3 partner-country breakdown files for 1970–2003) in downloadable machine-readable form used to compute 'imports from the South' in the paper (some ITCS historical CD-ROM volumes are paywalled)
missing.search_query: OECD ITCS SITC Rev.3 download 1970 2003 "International Trade by Commodity Statistics" "download" "CD-ROM" "data"
